item.title: Batters, Asitha Fernando give Sri Lanka consolation win - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Sri Lanka Clinches Consolation Win Over New Zealand in Third ODI

Published on: Sat, Jan 11, 2025, 09:33 AM | Source: Cricbuzz

Sri Lanka gained a consolation win by clinching the third ODI against New Zealand by a massive margin of 140 runs, with significant contributions from batters and bowlers.

  • Sri Lanka set the highest score of the series, reaching 290 runs.
  • Asitha Fernando took three wickets in the powerplay, devastating New Zealand's batting lineup.
  • New Zealand struggled, collapsing to 21/5 early in their innings.
  • Mark Chapman scored a lone 81 runs but couldn't save the team from defeat.
  • Sri Lanka's Pathum Nissanka scored 66 runs, supported by Kusal Mendis and Janith Liyanage.
Brief Scores: Sri Lanka 290/8 (Pathum Nissanka 68, Kusal Mendis 54, Janith Liyanage 53; Matt Henry 4-55) beat New Zealand 150 all out (Mark Chapman 81; Asitha Fernando 3-26) by 140 runs

This win serves as a morale booster for Sri Lanka in their tour, showcasing their batting depth and bowling prowess.

item.title: BCCI Calls Meeting With Gautam Gambhir, Says Report. Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma May Be Given... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Discusses Future of Kohli and Rohit in Upcoming Meeting

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

The BCCI is set to hold a meeting with Gautam Gambhir and Chief Selector Ajit Agarkar to discuss the future of star players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma after recent disappointing performances in international cricket.

  • The upcoming meeting will review the recent tour to Australia and performances against New Zealand.
  • Concerns are growing about Kohli and Rohit's diminishing returns at the crease.
  • Selectors will also discuss team composition for the upcoming Champions Trophy in the UAE.
  • Questions remain over whether to transition younger players now or wait until after the next ICC event.
  • Kohli and Rohit's performances in the upcoming ODI Champions Trophy could be crucial for their futures.
"Both Kohli and Rohit have played just three ODIs in 2024 after the World Cup, which might be too light of a sample size to make a final call on their careers."

This meeting will also include a review of the Gamir-led coaching staff's performance and strategies moving forward.

item.title: Watch: Arshdeep Singh Shatters Ruturaj Gaikwad's Stumps, Makes Case For Champions Trophy - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Arshdeep Singh Shines in Vijay Hazare Trophy, Boosts Champions Trophy Bid

Date: January 11, 2025

Source: NDTV Sports

Arshdeep Singh is making waves as he takes impressive wickets in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, strengthening his case for selection in India's upcoming Champions Trophy squad.

  • Arshdeep took two wickets in his first two overs against Ruturaj Gaikwad and Siddhesh Veer.
  • His spell ended with impressive figures of 2/33 in six overs, aiding Punjab's bowling effort.
  • With Jasprit Bumrah's injury, Arshdeep's chances for inclusion in the Champions Trophy squad have significantly increased.
WHAT A SPELL BY ARSHDEEP SINGH - Arshdeep gets Ruturaj in the Vijay Hazare Trophy Quarters. Arshdeep is making a big case for Champions Trophy squad.

With continued strong performances, Arshdeep Singh is positioning himself as a key player for India’s future in white-ball cricket.

item.title: Inside photos of Rahul Dravid’s luxurious home, it costs…, its located in.. - India.com
item.description:
Inside Photos of Rahul Dravid’s Luxurious Home

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: India.com

Rahul Dravid, former Indian cricket captain and cricket legend, resides in a luxurious bungalow in Indira Nagar, Bangalore. The home reflects his elegant taste and serves as a testament to his successful cricketing career.

  • Dravid built his bungalow in 2014, showcasing modern architecture.
  • The house features spacious interiors and a sophisticated ambiance.
  • It is known for its beautiful design both inside and outside.
  • The property was reported to be valued at 4.2 crore in 2010.
  • Dravid is admired for his calm nature and contributions to cricket, both as a player and as a coach.
“With 24,177 runs in international cricket, Dravid is widely regarded as one of the greatest batsmen in cricket history.”

Dravid's legacy in cricket, alongside the elegance of his home, continues to inspire young cricketers and fans alike.

item.title: BCCI Takes Shock U-Turn On KL Rahul Selection In India Squad For England ODIs: Report - NDTV Sports
item.description:
BCCI Takes Shock U-Turn On KL Rahul Selection In India Squad For England ODIs: Report

Date: 11 January 2025Source: NDTV

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) has reversed its decision regarding KL Rahul's participation in the upcoming ODI series against England. Initially resting him, the board has now requested his availability as they aim to provide him with match practice ahead of the Champions Trophy in February.

  • BCCI had initially agreed to KL Rahul's break from the ODI assignment.
  • Recent developments show the board now wants him available for selection.
  • Rahul's performance in the Test series in Australia was notable, being the third-highest run-getter for India.
  • Competition for the wicketkeeper batter's slot includes Rishabh Pant and Sanju Samson.
  • The board is seeking an extension from the ICC for the Champions Trophy squad announcement.
“The selectors initially decided to rest Rahul… However, they had a rethink and the BCCI has now asked him to play…”

This change signifies the BCCI's emphasis on Rahul's performance potential and readiness for future tournaments, demonstrating a dynamic approach to player management.

item.title: Border-Gavaskar Trophy: What ball-tracking and control data tell us - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Border-Gavaskar Trophy: What ball-tracking and control data tell us

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: ESPN Cricinfo

In the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy, India's bowling strategy against Australia proved effective, highlighting significant differences in their approaches to good lengths and seam movement.

  • India successfully bowled in the 6-8 metre good length range, frequently hitting the stumps.
  • Australia struggled with their traditional 5-7 metre lengths, conceding runs and struggling to connect.
  • Seam movement remained a key factor, with Jasprit Bumrah achieving notable deviation.
  • Defensive batting akin to Cheteshwar Pujara's style proved effective for Australia.
  • India's reliance on Bumrah highlighted vulnerabilities in their other bowlers.
  • Australia effectively used bouncers, with significant success compared to India's bowling tactics.
  • Both sides faced challenges with false shots, yet Australia managed to capitalize better during critical moments.
“India were actually a little unlucky... but, then again, India were really lucky in Brisbane with the rain.”

In conclusion, the series showcased crucial insights into the impact of bowling lengths and seam movement, offering lessons for future match strategies.

item.title: Exclusive: Giggs on golf with Guardiola, Man United help and Salford City plans - Manchester Evening News
item.description:
Giggs Reflects on Salford City's Journey and FA Cup Clash with Manchester City

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Manchester Evening News

Ryan Giggs discusses the Class of 92’s ownership of Salford City as they prepare to face Manchester City in the FA Cup, reflecting on their progress and ambitions.

  • Salford City reached the FA Cup third round for the first time after defeating Cheltenham Town.
  • The club, owned by the Class of 92 including Giggs, faces a challenging match against Manchester City.
  • Giggs expresses enjoyment in his role as director of football and being involved in management again.
  • He emphasizes the club's goal to nurture local talent and grow their academy.
  • Giggs hopes for continued support from the community to achieve Championship aspirations.
"I want to come down to the Peninsula on Saturday and support the lads in what is going to be an exciting end to the season." - Ryan Giggs

Giggs looks forward to Saturday’s match at the Etihad, aiming to inspire local support and promote Salford City's philosophy of attacking football.

item.title: Ajit Agarkar rejects KL Rahul's request for break, orders him to play England ODIs for Champions Trophy prep: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ajit Agarkar rejects KL Rahul's request for break, orders him to play England ODIs for Champions Trophy prep

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Ajit Agarkar's selection committee has rejected KL Rahul's request for a break from the upcoming ODIs against England, emphasizing the need for match practice ahead of the Champions Trophy.

  • Rahul's initial request for a break was due to fatigue after a demanding Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • The committee initially agreed but later reversed their decision, prioritizing his preparation for the Champions Trophy.
  • Rahul's performance in the 2023 ODI World Cup gives him an edge over competitors like Rishabh Pant and Sanju Samson.
The selectors initially decided to rest Rahul but had a rethink, emphasizing the need for match practice ahead of the Champions Trophy.

This decision reflects the selectors' strategy to ensure key players like Rahul are in form as preparations intensify for the major tournament in February.

item.title: SA20 2025: Match 3, PR vs SEC Match Prediction – Who will win today’s SA20 match between PR vs SEC? - CricTracker
item.description:

Date: January 10, 2025  |   Source: CricTracker

The Paarl Royals are set to face off against the Sunrisers Eastern Cape in the third match of the SA20 2025 at Boland Park.

Sunrisers Eastern Cape, the defending champions, aim to start their season strong, while Paarl Royals hope for improved performance after last season's hiccup.

Key Points:

  • Sunrisers Eastern Cape won the SA20 2024 final.
  • Paarl Royals were knocked out in the Eliminator of the previous edition.
  • Aiden Markram leads the Sunrisers, while Dinesh Karthik is a notable addition to the Royals.
  • Pitch conditions favor batters with low bounce but potential assistance for spinners.
“Team batting first is predicted to win the match.”

Fans are eager to see how both teams adapt to the pitch conditions and the performances of key players.

item.title: India's Champions Trophy squad announcement set to be postponed: Report - Moneycontrol
item.description:

  • The announcement was expected to coincide with the home white-ball series against England.
  • BCCI is citing commitments in Australia for a Test series as a reason for the delay.
  • The provisional squad will likely include players based on performance in the three ODIs against England.
"The BCCI, citing recent commitments in Australia for the Test series, is expected to request for more time."

This delay reflects the complex scheduling and preparations necessary for major international cricket tournaments.

The Big Bash League continues with Adelaide Strikers facing Brisbane Heat in match 31 at Adelaide Oval. The Strikers are struggling this season, while the Heat aims to secure a better playoff position.

Key Points:

  • Match details: Adelaide Strikers vs Brisbane Heat, Match 31, BBL 2024-25 at Adelaide Oval.
  • Strikers have lost five of their seven matches, sitting at the bottom of the table.
  • Brisbane Heat is in fourth place, winning three out of seven matches.
  • Pitch report indicates a favorable batting surface with an average first innings score of 158.
  • Predicted top performers: Max Bryant (Brisbane Heat) and Lloyd Pope (Adelaide Strikers).
“Brisbane Heat are predicted to win based on current form and head-to-head statistics.”

This match is crucial for both teams, particularly for the Strikers in their quest for a turnaround.

item.title: 'Chat GPT product': Harshit Rana and Nitish Rana called out for supporting Gautam Gambhir with similar statements - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Harshit and Nitish Rana Called Out for Supporting Gautam Gambhir

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Harshit Rana and Nitish Rana have come under scrutiny for their identical statements on social media in support of Gautam Gambhir, following comments made by Manoj Tiwary that criticized Gambhir’s coaching methods.

  • Manoj Tiwary labeled Gambhir a "hypocrite" for supporting foreign coaches despite previously criticizing their appointment.
  • Aakash Chopra pointed out the similarities in Rana's statements, suggesting they feel like a "Chat GPT product".
  • Gambhir's coaching received backlash after India’s recent losses, including the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
Aakash Chopra stated, "There are many similarities in both statements, or someone wrote them and sent them to post on social media. It felt like both statements were written by the same man or machine. It could be Chat GPT, for all we know."

The controversy highlights concerns regarding Gambhir's coaching effectiveness and the authenticity of public support from players.

The BCCI selection committee is preparing to announce the squads for the Champions Trophy 2025 and the England series amidst anticipation and speculation regarding key player selections.

  • The provisional squads need to be submitted by February 12 and can be modified until February 13.

  • Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are expected to be retained in the 50-over squads.
  • Discussions around the vice-captaincy role are ongoing, particularly concerning Jasprit Bumrah's fitness.

“The BCCI selectors are set to announce the India squads for the upcoming white-ball series against England and the Champions Trophy 2025.”

The upcoming squad announcements are crucial for India's preparations as they aim for success in the Champions Trophy under new and returning players.

item.title: New Twist To Champions Trophy Squad Saga, BCCI Seeks Extension. Mohammed Shami To... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
New Twist To Champions Trophy Squad Saga, BCCI Seeks Extension

Date: January 25, 2025
Source: NDTV

As the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) nears the Champions Trophy squad selection deadline, a big boost has reportedly come in the form of veteran pacer Mohammed Shami. Though Shami couldn't prove his fitness for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, it has been reported that he is all set to be picked for India's ODI squad against England, as well as the Champions Trophy, if his comeback goes as planned.

  • Shami has received clearance for a return to the national team, following ankle injuries.
  • The BCCI has sought an extension from the ICC over the announcement of the India squad for the Champions Trophy.
  • The T20I squad for the England series is expected to be announced soon.
  • England and India will play five T20Is and three ODIs starting January 22, 2025.
"Though ICC allows teams to make changes one month after the provisional squad is announced, it seems like the BCCI requires more time to finalize the roster for the tournament in Pakistan and UAE."

In conclusion, the BCCI's request for an extension highlights the complexities of finalizing player rosters amidst injuries and the need for strategic preparation for upcoming tournaments.
